Exaggerate: The claim of "serious voter fraud" in New Hampshire may be an exaggeration as there is no evidence or complaints to support it.
Understate: The claim may be understating the lack of evidence or complaints of voter fraud in New Hampshire.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as no evidence or complaints have been provided to substantiate the claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes the existence of serious voter fraud in New Hampshire without providing any evidence or complaints.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the lack of evidence or complaints of voter fraud in New Hampshire.
